fields.description:
We need to migrate some technical-related content into the Eucalyptus documentation before www.eucalyptus.com is retired in October. Dmitrii and Dionysia have approved.

Ideally, we want to migrate this content before end of September, earlier if possible. With the release schedules, what is the earliest we could publish new pages in the online docs?

The content to be migrated are two separate types of items:
1) Compatibility Matrix
2) Technology Preview

1)
https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility/3.4
https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility/4.0
https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/compatibility/4.1

Note: please check with [~smaynard] and [~dmitrii] if we need to migrate the 3.4 compatibility matrix now.

2)
https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/iaas/technology-preview

This page is a definition of the Technology preview restrictions that has been reviewed by HP Legal and needs to be kept as-is until we are directed otherwise. It should be stored in a file that we can reference in each release (e.g. maybe in the "shared" directory)

If we add a "Technology Preview" section in each Release Notes version similar to the "Resolved Security Issues", recommend we use this existing text as an introductory paragraph:

"Technology preview features provide early access to upcoming product innovations, enabling you to test functionality and provide feedback during the development process. Â These features are not for production and may have additional restrictions."

Note: link the  "additional restrictions" phrase to the above migrated Technology preview page.

The intro paragraph can be followed by a bullet list of each of the tech preview features for the release.

attachment.filename: Technology Preview Features Support Scope _ HP Helion Eucalyptus.pdf

fields.summary: Add new pages - Migrate technical content from www.eucalyptus.com

comments.body:
[~kmeredith], [~scottb] For Compatibility Matrix, please be sure to update links in the following places:
- http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/  (Support matrix)
- docs landing page (shared/index.html)
- any other references in the docs

(Note that today JIRA had a _really_ big hiccup: When Kristina and I were working in this ticket, I could see _no_ hints that Scott had worked here yesterday, and he finished checking in today, just around the time Kristina and I were meeting.)

Notes from meeting with Kristina - 

Spoke to [~khadges] today and understand the requirements (have notes). I believe I understand the technical details of what needs to be done; want to confirm with [~scottb] to be sure I didn't miss something.  

[~khadges] requests work completion by end of September, earlier if possible. Also would like to implement in 4.1.2 branch, which is do-able. Target to complete work and publish in 4.1.2 branch by early Sept.

AFTER the meeting, I saw Scott's work -

http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#install-guide/intro_compatibility_matrix.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#install-guide/intro_tech_preview_support.html

... so the first cut is in the 4.1.2 branch and content is in the Installation Guide for now. Thanks, Scott, for the work and for pre-answering my technical questions by doing it! :)

Will work with Euca doc team, [~eucacolby] and [~smaynard] on final implementation details.

[~kmeredith] Please add the following tasks to this ticket:

On the shared/index.html page, update the urls for Deployment Planning and Reference Architectures

- Deployment planning: change url to 
https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html#install-guide/index.html

- Reference architectures: change url to:
http://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/reference-architectures
The old euca website is redirecting now so I found cached versions of the pages. Attaching them now.
[~kmeredith] Based on the page Summer created on support.eucalyptus.com, we only need the 4.0 and 4.1 compatibility matrices. You do not need to add a page for v3.4.

[~khadges] who can help me know what to do on these pages:

1. http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#install-guide/index.html 
FastStart command includes www.euca:
{code}bash <(curl -Ls
https://www.eucalyptus.com/install){code}
Where should the above faststart command point to now?

2. https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html#release-notes/index.html and 
https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html#euca2ools-release-notes/index.html
Includes various links to www.euca - updated best I know - is the following OK?
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/index.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#release-notes/index.html

3. There are all sorts of commands in Install Guide, to install from the packages, where should they point to now? For example:
{code}yum install
http://downloads.eucalyptus.com/software/eucalyptus/4.1/centos/6/x86_64/epel-release-6.noarch.rpm{code}

4. http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#image-guide/ig_task_eustore.html
Where will the emis be hosted now? (points to http://emis.eucalyptus.com/ now)

5. New http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#install-guide/installing_euca_software_signing.html page that Scott created includes pointers to the keys, which are also on www.euca (separate email related to this)

hey [~scottb] item #3 above is potentially huge ... unless we fix it with a conref, but even that's big once. Have you had to do this before? What if we added a note to Doc History or the Release notes for 4.1.2, saying anytime you see "downloads.eucalyptus.com" then go to "downloads.xxx.com" instead?

[~khadges] I actually do not know where the emis and packages are going - do you know? It's a bit confusing because from this page: http://www8.hp.com/us/en/cloud/helion-eucalyptus-downloads.html if I click the purple Package Repo button, it just points me to the Installation Guide.

FYI -  www.eucalyptus.com rewrite rules will continue to be active after the site is retired. We are working on migrating the rewrite rules to HP systems.

1. Where should the above faststart command point to now?

KMH: http://hphelion.com/eucalyptus-install

2. https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html#release-notes/index.html and 
https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html#euca2ools-release-notes/index.html
Includes various links to www.euca - updated best I know - is the following OK?
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#euca2ools-release-notes/index.html
http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#release-notes/index.html

KMH: Yep. They are OK.

3. There are all sorts of commands in Install Guide, to install from the packages, where should they point to now? 

KMH:  downloads.eucalyptus.com is owned by IT and the Release Team. Please contact Kyle Wade or someone on the release team for when these will migrate. To my knowledge, downloads will continue to use the same Euca release venue for the foreseeable future.

4. http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#image-guide/ig_task_eustore.html
Where will the emis be hosted now? (points to http://emis.eucalyptus.com/ now)

KMH: Same answer as #3. Contact Vic for more information.

5. New http://packages.release.eucalyptus-systems.com/documentation/origin/4.1/#install-guide/installing_euca_software_signing.html page that Scott created includes pointers to the keys, which are also on www.euca (separate email related to this)

KMH: Vika will be working with the Euca docs team on where to put the keys.

Thanks, [~khadges] - a couple clarifications, please.

A. http://hphelion.com/eucalyptus-install - confirm it's not https?

B. why change reference architectures to another www page? - per your comment above - 
 http://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/reference-architectures

[~khadges] what will the replacement URL be for this: https://www.eucalyptus.com/eucalyptus-cloud/documentation ? http://docs.hpcloud.com/#euca/euca-landing-page.html has 3 links to check - documentation/euca/euca-landing-page.dita Needs to change from this:
  • Documentation
  • Support
  • Support matrix
    • To this:
  • Documentation
  • Support
  • Support matrix

To do:
* Ken/Dima/Dionysia - provide EOL cut-off list so we can reduce rel notes / archive links to old docs
* Greg (?) to update http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/ (Support matrix) (or tell me how)

Posted updated docs: 
https://www.eucalyptus.com/docs/eucalyptus/4.1.2/index.html

Per Dionysia and Scott, we'll leave the archive docs (to older versions) as is for now. EOL decision might come later. (FYI https://support.eucalyptus.com/hc/en-us/articles/205143039-HP-Helion-Eucalyptus-Product-Life-Cycle shows EOL cycle.)

Will send an email to Dionysia for Greg/bug on Helion docs, to update the 3 bullet item links here:  to update http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/ (Support matrix) ... once www.eucalyptus.com is gone and the 3 new URLs are understood.

Sent email to Greg with the final update.

http://docs.hpcloud.com/#euca/euca-landing-page.html updates:

Documentation should be http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.1.2/
Support should be http://support.eucalyptus.com
Support matrix should be http://docs.hpcloud.com/eucalyptus/4.1.2/#shared/intro_compatibility_matrix_4.1.html
